config_description: GC Pauses greater than 200 ms will be logged at INFO level This threshold can be adjusted to minimize logging if necessary
developer_understanding_on_working: The gc_log_threshold_in_ms configuration sets a threshold for logging GC pauses greater than the specified value (200 ms) at INFO level. This threshold can be adjusted to control the amount of logging.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a garbage collection event occurs and the pause time exceeds the threshold value of 200 ms.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Adjusting the gc_log_threshold_in_ms configuration can impact the amount of logging related to GC pauses. Lowering the threshold can result in more frequent logging of GC pauses, while increasing the threshold can reduce the amount of logging. This can affect the system's performance and the amount of information available for troubleshooting GC-related issues.
